temperature_0.5.answer: The man received a pig heart transplant because it was the only currently available option for him, as he was ineligible for a conventional heart transplant or an artificial heart pump [1].

temperature_0.5.question: Why are companies are moving out of Russia?
temperature_0.5.answer: Companies are moving out of Russia in response to its invasion of Ukraine, which has led to an exodus affecting various sectors of the economy [1]. Major companies such as Ford, General Motors, Exxon, BP, Shell, Equinor, TotalEnergies, Hilton, Marriott, 3M, Dow, Citigroup, Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan, and Deutsche Bank have either suspended operations, halted exports, shut down offices, or announced their intent to exit their Russian businesses [1,2,3]. The situation in Ukraine and the resulting sanctions have created concerns and challenges for companies operating in Russia, leading to their decision to scale back or leave the country [4].
